page.title: 16RETIREMENT HOMES 06200219
page.content: KILKENNY WAS A BIG HOUSE.IN 1901 IT WAS A TUDOR PRIVATE HOUSE.IT IS A 150 YARDS AWAY FROM THE SEA.NOW FOR THE LAST YEAR IT HAS BEEN OPEN AS A RESIDENTAL HOME.THEY CAN HAVE UP TO 9 RESIDENTS.ONE OF THE RESIDENTS IS NINETY THREE YEARS OLD. SHE OPENED ANNE'S RESTAURANT , IN THE 1920'S AFTER A VISIT TO FRINTON WHEN SHE COULD NOT BUY A DECENT CUP OF COFFEE IN THE TOWN. SHE CAN STILL REMEMBER SERVING THE LATE PRINCE OF WALES. THE KILKENNY IS A FAMILY RUN HOME FOR OLD PEOPLE. IT COSTS Â£135_Â£175 PER WEEK.THERE IS A SPECIAL CHAIR LIFT FOR THOSE WHO CAN NOT WALK UP AND DOWN THE STAIRS.THEY HAVE THEIR OWN BED_SIT ROOMS.WITH THEIR OWN TOILET AND BATHROOM. NURSING CARE IS PROVIDED FOR THOSE WHO NEED IT. MEALS ARE PREPARED IN THE MAIN KITCHEN AND EATEN COMMUNALLY.
